# localizedLowercase

**Instance Property**

Returns a version of the string with all letters converted to lowercase, taking into account the current locale.

## Declaration

```swift
var localizedLowercase: String { get }
```

## Discussion

Case transformations aren’t guaranteed to be symmetrical or to produce strings of the same lengths as the originals. See [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSString/lowercased] for an example.

## Changing Case

- **lowercased**: A lowercase representation of the string.
- **lowercased(with:)**: Returns a version of the string with all letters converted to lowercase, taking into account the specified locale.
- **uppercased**: An uppercase representation of the string.
- **localizedUppercase**: Returns a version of the string with all letters converted to uppercase, taking into account the current locale.
- **uppercased(with:)**: Returns a version of the string with all letters converted to uppercase, taking into account the specified locale.
- **capitalized**: A capitalized representation of the string.
- **localizedCapitalized**: Returns a capitalized representation of the receiver using the current locale.
- **capitalized(with:)**: Returns a capitalized representation of the receiver using the specified locale.
